metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14553 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Pluggable Auth). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.30and prior and 8.0.20 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQLServer accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Integrity impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-0ubuntu3').
